Educational Qualifications: Matriculate Educated at S.P.S., Sonpur, Distt. Saran,Bihar and Vidyasagar College, Calcutta, West Bengal (left College to join Freedom Movement)
Other Information: Freedom Fighter and Founder (i) Harijan Gandhi Gramin School; (ii) Railway College Sonepur (Saran) Bihar; (iii) Mahila Maha Vidhyalya Sonepur, Saran; (iv) Ram Sunder Das High School, Kharika, Saran; and (v) Two colleges in Dighwara, P.O. Dighwara, Saran, Bihar; Bihar Banihar Sangh; Hind Mazdoor Sabha, Bihar; Member, Board of Directors, Bihar; Small Scale Industries Association
Name: Das,Shri Ram Sundar
Positions Held:
1945-48
Associated with Congress Socialist Party

1948
Secretary, Congress Socialist Party, Sonepur

1952-68
Member, District Executive Council, Praja Socialist Party

1956-67
Member, Provincial Executive Council, Praja Socialist Party, Bihar

1968-77
Member, Bihar Legislative Council

1977-79
Chairman, Committee for the Welfare of SC & ST, Bihar Legislative Assembly

1977-80
Member, Bihar Legislative Assembly from General Assembly Seat of Sonepur, Saran, Bihar

Apr. 1979 to Feb. 1980
Chief Minister, Bihar

1990-91
Member, Bihar Legislative Assembly, Chairman, Committee for the Welfare of SC & ST, Bihar Legislative Assembly; Convener, Privileges Committee, Bihar Legislative Assembly

1991
Elected to 10th Lok Sabha
Secretary, Praja Socialist Party, Bihar Member, National Executive Council; Praja Socialist Party Member, Executive Council and Parliamentary Board, Janata Party Member, Executive Committee and Political Affairs Committee, Janata Dal, in previous years.

04 Aug 2008
Member, Committee on Installation of Potraits/Statues of National Leaders and Parliamentarians in Parliament House Complex

2009
Re-elected to 15th Lok Sabha (2nd term)
Leader, Janata Dal (United) Parliamentary Party, Lok Sabha

June 2009
Member, Business Advisory Committee

19 Aug. 2009
Member, General Purposes Committee

31 Aug. 2009
Member, Committee on Energy
